intro: Thlaspi libanoticum, commonly known as the Lebanon cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments, often found in the Mediterranean region. The plant has small, green, spoon-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny white or yellow flowers. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often used in traditional medicine. Thlaspi libanoticum is also known for its tolerance to drought and high temperatures.
